description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to increase agricultural production and marketing in marshland and hillside areas targeted for development under the Project in an environmentally sustainable manner.

condition.narrative: Adoption by the Borrower of a Project Implementation Manual satisfactory to IDA
Establishment of a Designated Account and deposit of first installment of counterpart funds

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, production of rice in marshlands rehabilitated or developed under RSSP2 has increased by at least 100 percent relative to the baseline.

comment.narrative: As per the PAD, this PDO indicator has a rolling baseline as and when the total selection of marshlands to be developed isfinalized. We have updated the baseline at midterm. The final update baseline has changed from 8,757 tons to 5,527 tons because ofchange in the marshlandrehabilitation and development planning as 1800 ha developed in Muvumba 8 marshland have not yet beenbrought under rice.
End target updated (see comments under rolling baseline)
This progress comprises of 1,358tin season A and9,874t in seasonB.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 20 cooperatives with business plans and supported by RSSP2 have increased their revenues from sales by 50% relative to the baseline.

baseline.value: 0 cooperatives (beginning revenue-from-sales figure for each cooperative to be determined following the identification ofparticipating cooperatives)

comment.narrative: 67 out of 81coops haveincreasedrevenue over acombination ofseason A andseason B of 2011over the baselineby more than50%.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 80 cooperatives supported by the Project have quality business plans under implementation.

comment.narrative: Of the 83 cooperatives supported by RSSP, 81 have been assisted by their local service provider todevelop business plans. Theseinturn were validated as of good quality by the RSSP project staffand are in the process of implementation.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 9,900 additional ha of hillsides have been sustainably developed by the Project (EDPRS/PSTA indicator).

comment.narrative: Slightly over 10,000 ha, owned by approximately 20,000 households have been protected againstsoil erosion using differenttechniques, including radical terracing, during the second phase ofRSSP. 8,356 ha were protected during the 2009 and 2010 season,and the remaining 1,740 hawere completed in 2011.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 50% of farmers in marshland and hillside areas developed or rehabilitated by the RSSP1 & 2 haveadopted sustainable marshland or hillside intensification technolo

baseline.value: 25% of farmers have adopted at least two of the identified practices

target.value: 50% of farmers have adopted at least two of the identified practices

actual.value: 98% of supported HH have adopted sustainable marshland or hillside intensification tehnologies

comment.narrative: The progress on this indicator was measured during the Impact Assessment Survey ended by February 2012. The adoption ofsustainable technologies by farmers has been measured directly fromthe IA survey. Of the techniques included in the survey, soilfertility management, IPM,conservation tillage, contour bunding, construction of erosion control structures includingterraces,vegetative strips, and agroforestry practices, over 75% of farmers, on both marshlands and hillsidefarms were using soilfertility management techniques, IPM, vegetative strips and agroforestry.Radical terracing was the least popular, no doubtreflecting the cost of the technique, and only athird of farmers had adopted conservation tillage

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 3,300 additional ha of irrigated marshlands have been rehabilitated or developed by the Project(EDPRS/PSTA indicator).

comment.narrative: Nine sites were rehabilitated or dams built. Eight dams were built and on theother sites rehabilitation works took place. HoweverSome planned work was rescheduled toRSSP3 because of increased costs relative to the budget. Under RSSP2 additional 3,324 ha ofmarshland was brought into operation.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 6 additional cooperatives supported by RSSP2 are marketing certified maize or potato seed.

actual.value: 26 of which 15 certified maize and potatoe seed producing cooperatives with additional 11 certified rice producing cooperativesand3 certifiedwheat seed cooperatives

comment.narrative: The Target was by far achieved. There is general agreement that seed production is a profitableventure and that farmers generallytry to become seed producers if they can. There is an overall shortage of certified seeds in Rwanda.

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, with at least 75% of the rural infrastructure sub-projects funded through the LDF, the majority of usersare satisfied one year after the sub-project was completed.

actual.value: Over all 98% users satisfied. 65% very satisfied by infrastructure33% quite satisfied

comment.narrative: The Impact Assessment revealed that 98% of users are either very satisfied or quite satisfied by the infrastructure

title.narrative: By the end of the Project, at least 75% of the farmers in irrigated marshlands rehabilitated or developed by the Project (RSSP1 andRSSP2) are paying water charges through water user associations.

target.value: 75% paying water charges through water users associations

comment.narrative: This percentage reflects the current proportion of farmers paying water charges even as their formal registration process isunderway. WUAs committees were elected and trained in all 20 marshlands. A draft Ministerial Order adhering to international WUAstandards has been gazetted in December 2011; registration of these 77% of farmers paying water charges into formal WUAs will beundertakenprior to Project end.

The number of direct beneficiaries supported by RSSP include 34,603 members of rice cooperatives and 47,016members ofcooperativessupporting other crops (mainly maize, wheat and Irish potatoes). Of thecombined total, 43% were women and 57% were men.
